newsitem.title: FINLAND: Rautaruukki sees '96 profit at '94 level.
newsitem.headline: Rautaruukki sees '96 profit at '94 level.

text.p: Finnish steel group Rautaruukki Oy on Monday repeated a forecast that it expects full-year 1996 profit before extras and tax to fall to the level of 1994.
"Profit before extraordinary items, reserves and taxes is estimated to be at the level of 1994, when it was 658 million markka," Rautaruukki said in its January-August interim report.
Last year, that profit was 954 million markka.
"Consolidated turnover in 1996 is estimated to be slightly less than 13 billion markka," Rautaruukki said.
"Demand for steel is expected to grow somewhat during the latter part of the year in Rautaruukki's main markets, the Nordic countries and elsewhere in Western Europe," it added.
"The fall in the prices of steel products has come to a halt," Rautaruukki said.
